summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons disciplinary hearing report for inmate Nicolas Tartglione at MCC New York, detailing his admission of guilt for possessing a black Samsung cellphone (a hazardous tool) in his cell on June 26, 2019. The report documents the hearing process, evidence considered, and sanctions imposed including loss of good conduct time and disciplinary segregation.

keyFacts: Inmate Nicolas Tartglione (Register No. 78514-054) admitted to possessing a black Samsung cellphone in his cell at MCC New York on June 26, 2019.
The incident report was initially suspended pending ROSA referral and declined for prosecution by the AUSA/US Attorney's Office before being processed administratively.
Tartglione waived his right to a staff representative and witnesses, and fully admitted guilt during the disciplinary hearing.
Sanctions imposed included 41 days disallowance of good conduct time, 60 days disciplinary segregation, and 365 days loss of visit privileges.
The hearing officer emphasized zero tolerance for possession of hazardous tools like cellphones in correctional settings due to security threats.
